title: Cruise the Coast
description: Rent Ebikes and cruise the coast with minimal effort, a great activity with friends and easy to pair with an exciting lunch along the ocean.

title: Waterboarding for Fun and Profit
address: 2214 E Cliff Dr, Santa Cruz, CA 95062
tags: Water, Board, Paddle, Harbor, Lesson, Ocean, Outside
description: Learn to Paddle Board on the scerene Santa Cruz Harbor(and see if you can spot our local sea monster). Make sure to book in advance

title: Taking the High Road
description: Explore a beautiful section of this UC campus while getting some great excersise. Protip: If you go early enough on a saturday you may not even have to see any students.

title: Feeling Bold-er?
description: Tired of children having all the fun clambering on things? Get a full body workout and prepare for your next hiest with these short "boulder" routes.

title: Smile and Waves (beginer)
description: Where better to learn surfing than where it was first introduced to the US? Nowhere that's where.

title: Smile and Waves (experienced)
address: 700 W Cliff Dr, Santa Cruz, CA 95060
description: Do you own a surfboard and scoff at my poor understanding of when to surf? Then skip the lessons to surf the legendary Steamer Lane, or wherever else your superior skills take you.
what to bring: Surfboard, Wetsuit, Sunscreen, Plenty of waves

title: Real Skating (don't tell the boarders)
description: Grab your bell bottoms and get ready to groove like its the 70s. Only open Wensday Friday Saturday and cash only.
what to bring: Excersise clothes, a willingness to fall

title: Jumprasic Park
address: 299 San Lorenzo Blvd, Santa Cruz, CA 95060
description: If world class surfing and paddleboarding havn't convinced you of Santa Cruz's skills with boards it's time to try out skateboarding. There's a reason skating's oldest continuos company is named after our humble town ;)

title: Anything but Bored, Walk
description: With it's colorful lights and endless entertainment its easy to find yourself strolling up and down the mile long boardwalk for hours. This makes for fantastic excersise so long as you can make sure not to stop for too many delicious churros. Only open on weekends.

title: Rocks and Roll
address: 2470 El Rancho Dr, Santa Cruz, CA 95060
description: Whether indoor climbing is getting repetitive or your van broke down on the way to Yosemite, this craig is a great enviorment for intermediete to advanced climbers to have some fun.
what to bring: Harnesses, belay partner, 50m+ climbing rope, Trad rack, Climbing shoes, Chalk, Belay device, Some tunes

title: European Football
description: I'm gonna assume you've got this one

title: Tennis(by the)sea
address: Neary Lagoon Public Tennis Courts, Santa Cruz, CA 95060
description: Depite apperently being "all in the wrist", tennis is a fantastic way to work on speed, agility, and cardio.
what to bring: Tennis racquets, Tennis balls, Tennis shoes, Tennis water

title: Basketball
description: Ain't no rule says a dog can't play basketball and ain't no rule that says you can't either.

title: I Can't Belive its Not Ocean!
address: 275 Harvey West Blvd, Santa Cruz, CA 95060
description: Make sure to check the hours before going.

title: Beachless Beach Vollyball
address: East Remote Parking Lot Santa Cruz, CA 95064
description: Sand may be course, rough, irritating, and get everywhere, but it makes a great court for vollyball. A supurb activity for large groups

title: frisbee golf
address: East Remote Parking Lot Santa Cruz, CA 95064
description: If you're fed up with aliens monopolizing the flying saucer market, toss around a few of your own while admiring the views from the UCSC campus

title: dance
description: Experts widly agree dancing with an instructor watching is the next best thing to dancing like no one is watching, so give it a go and learn a few new moves.

title: yog-aaaahh my back
description: Make sure to check the link for exact class schedules. Ironically the start times aren't always flexible

title: The Fountain of Youth
description: Sure everyone says "these bike trails are like a playground for adults" or "climbing is like being a kid again" but we all know its better to get the real thing. Once the kids have gone home theirs no reason not to unleash your inner child.

title: Slackin' Off
description: Learn the cool adult version of walking along the curb at recess. Available on the 2nd Monday and 4th Wednesday of every month.

title: Cruise the Clouds
description: I shouldn't have to sell you on mountain biking trails so good they created two of the largest mountain bike manufacturers...so why are you still here?
what to bring: Bike, Bike helmet, Layers, Water, Snack
